Author: Moderator
Message: Hello Azelle.

Author: Moderator
Message: Thank you for participating in this study!

Author: Moderator
Message: Are you able to read this?

Author: Azelle
Message: Yes

Author: Moderator
Message: Good. In the next posts, I'll be going over the rules of the "game" you're about to play.

Author: Moderator
Message: Once I'll be done, I'll ask you if you've understood the rules, and if you haven't I'll explain them in different words.

Author: Moderator
Message: You're about to talk to Andrew. Andrew is a fictive character that has been completely created for the purpose of this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: You'll be talking to him twice.

Author: Moderator
Message: The only difference between the two conversations you'll have with him, is that in one of them Andrew will be played by a real human.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the other, it will be played by an Artificial Intelligence we are developing.

Author: Moderator
Message: We will call the Human and the Artificial Intelligence the Actors.

Author: Moderator
Message: The order in which you'll be talking to each Actor is random.

Author: Moderator
Message: You will not be talking twice with the same Actor.

Author: Moderator
Message: Both the Artificial Intelligence and the Human will try to portray the same Andrew in the most convincing way they can.

Author: Moderator
Message: Your goal is simple. After talking to the two actors, you'll have to guess which one was the Artificial Intelligence and which one was the Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Whenever you have made your decision, you are able to stop the conversation by saying [STOP]

Author: Moderator
Message: Each conversation will last for 15 minutes maximum if you do not decide to stop it before.

Author: Moderator
Message: Please, keep your posts to text only (No smileys, no links... etc)

Author: Moderator
Message: Do not type more than one post per answer.

Author: Moderator
Message: Do you understand the rules and what you have to do?

Author: Azelle
Message: Yes.  Talk to each of them, type [STOP] when I have made my choice.

Author: Moderator
Message: Good. Andrew will start the conversation. The 15 minutes will start after your answer. Are you ready?

Author: Azelle
Message: Yes

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: Azelle
Message: Hello.  How are you today?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm quite alright. You?

Author: Azelle
Message: I'm okay.  Tell me, what are your favorite hobbies?

Author: Andrew
Message: I love video games mostly.

Author: Azelle
Message: Oh?  What are you favorite games?

Author: Andrew
Message: Minecraft. I play way too much of it.

Author: Azelle
Message: How long have you played it?

Author: Andrew
Message: About 2 years.

Author: Azelle
Message: Ah.  I played it way back when maps weren't infinite.

Author: Andrew
Message: Are you still playing it?

Author: Azelle
Message: I haven't played it in a while.  I couldn't get the hang of doing some of the redstone stuff.  Just seemed tedious.

Author: Andrew
Message: It's quite interesting to do though.

Author: Azelle
Message: What have you made with redstone, if anything?

Author: Andrew
Message: I made a functional clock once.

Author: Azelle
Message: That must have taken quite a lot of time, huh?

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah, it wasn't easy to do.

Author: Azelle
Message: Do you play any other games?

Author: Andrew
Message: I finished the last Mass Effect a month ago.

Author: Azelle
Message: Which one was that?

Author: Andrew
Message: Andromeda.

Author: Azelle
Message: I could never get into the series.  That and I've always heard the quality got worse and worse with each one.

Author: Andrew
Message: That's not quite true actually.

Author: Azelle
Message: Oh?  Why do you say that?

Author: Andrew
Message: I liked each episode more than the previous one. Except maybe for Andromeda.

Author: Azelle
Message: Why not Andromeda?

Author: Andrew
Message: The story wasn't as good as with the previous ones.

Author: Azelle
Message: What was the story about?

Author: Andrew
Message: Settling a new galaxy.

Author: Azelle
Message: What was your favorite part about the game?

Author: Andrew
Message: The gameplay was quite good, and a fresh start feels nice.

Author: Azelle
Message: Have you played any other games from that developer?

Author: Andrew
Message: I like Dragon Age too.

Author: Azelle
Message: I liked the first one.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to?

Author: Azelle
Message: If I had to pick, the AI.

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright, we'll begin the next conversation. Andrew will start, then you'll have 15 minutes again after your answer. Are you ready?

Author: Azelle
Message: Yes

Author: Andrew
Message: hello!

Author: Azelle
Message: Hello.  How are you?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm doing alright. How about you?

Author: Azelle
Message: I'm doing okay.  Where are you from?

Author: Andrew
Message: I'm from Canada. I live in London. You?

Author: Azelle
Message: Middle of the US.  How has the weather been?

Author: Andrew
Message: A bit cooler than the previous week, which isn't a bad thing actually. It was way too hot for me.

Author: Azelle
Message: Yeah, I know that feeling.  What do you do for a living?

Author: Andrew
Message: Nothing at the moment. I'm a student, and I just started summer break.

Author: Azelle
Message: What are you studying?

Author: Andrew
Message: Biology. I was in my 3rd year.

Author: Azelle
Message: What do you plan to do after college?

Author: Andrew
Message: Hopefully research on the brain. Trying to figure out the biological basis of learning in particular.

Author: Azelle
Message: Interesting.  As in, trying to determine how the brain actually 'learns'?

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah. The different neural networks involved in learning fascinate me.

Author: Azelle
Message: What do you think would be possible if it was understood better?

Author: Andrew
Message: It would certainly help us deal more efficiently with Alzheimer's disease for one. It might also help us simulate it and make more intelligent programs inspired by biology.

Author: Azelle
Message: how would it help with alzheimer's?

Author: Andrew
Message: People with Alzheimer's disease tend to forget about recent memories, but keep the older ones. Trying to figure out more about the way we learn might shed some light on why that's the case.

Author: Azelle
Message: Is memory related to learning?

Author: Andrew
Message: It would seem that it is yes.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to in the first conversation?

Author: Azelle
Message: I think the first actor might be the actual person.

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to in the first conversation?

Author: Azelle
Message: Human

Author: Moderator
Message: Sorry about that.

Author: Moderator
Message: On a scale from 1 (not sure at all) to 7 (certain) how confident are you of your answer?

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright thank you for your participation! If you've given you e-mail, we'll send you some information about the results of this study in the coming months.

Author: Moderator
Message: If you have any comments you'd like to share, feel free to do so now, otherwise, you can now close this window.
